sub_topic: Identifying the maximum independent set in a graph.
message_1:
Consider a graph with 9 vertices as shown below. Identify the maximum independent set in this graph.

![Graph with 9 vertices](https://i.imgur.com/an5ZE5V.png)

What is the maximum number of non-adjacent vertices that can be selected from this graph?
message_2:
To find the maximum independent set in this graph, we need to select the maximum number of non-adjacent vertices. In this graph, we can select the following vertices: 1, 4, and 7. This is because these vertices are not connected to each other by any edges, and no other non-adjacent vertex can be added to this set without violating the independence condition.

Therefore, the maximum number of non-adjacent vertices that can be selected from this graph is 3.
